name: Factors that affect Reaction Rate
desc: Here we explore exactly what effects go into determining the reaction rate, why, and how they can alter the value.
notes:
Rate is the change in concentration over time

Collision Model: reactants must collide with enough energy in the right orientation for a reaction to take place

Physical State of Reactants Homogenous? If a solid, surface area becomes relevant

Concentration More molecules present means there is a greater likelihood for collisions to occur with the right energy and orientation, increasing the reaction rate

Temperature Greater absolute temperature means the molecules have a greater average kinetic energy which increases the likelihood of collisions occuring with the right orientation and energy for the reaction to take place

Activation Energy For a reaction to take place, the activation energy barrier must be overcome Catalysts can speed up a reaction by providing a reaction mechanism with a lower activation energy Note that catalysts are not part of the overall balanced reaction and are not created then consumed like intermediates Enzymes are a type of catalyst that we can analyze through the Enzyme-Substrate model
